class_notes:
Prerequisite: Medical Anthropology, Foundations of Global Health, or permission of instructor.


This is an advanced seminar in Medical Anthropology that focuses on the research and publications of Emory PhD alumni.  Its goal is to explore the past and to envision of future of Medical Anthropology.  Coursework will culminate with a mini-conference on campus March 31-April 2. Since 1994, there have been around 50 PhD students who have done research in Medical Anthropology, many of them also warned MPH degrees. They are now leaders in the field and have written around 60 books.  Each student in the seminar will focus on the work of a few of these anthropologists. Coursework will include research, analytical essays, zoom and in-person interviews, and videos that will be compiled into a new website. Full participation in planning and running the April mini-conference is required.
